displaytitle: No. 113, Après Le Siège (After the Siege), plate 39 from Album du siège : recueil de caricatures publiées pendant le siège dans le Charivari

titles.title: No. 113, Après Le Siège (After the Siege), plate 39 from Album du siège : recueil de caricatures publiées pendant le siège dans le Charivari

texts.textentryhtml: In collaboration with Daumier, the caricaturist Cham published a compilation of scenes from the catastrophic 1870–71 Siege of Paris by the Prussians. The lithographs had originally been printed in the satirical journal Le Charivari, whose title refers to a traditional rite of derision practiced throughout France that involved noise or "rough music." These cartoons satirized the political and social elements of the siege with often strikingly humorous insights into the undoubtedly appalling realities of life for the citizens of Paris. After the Siege shows the shameful return to Paris of those who had fled the city and were forced to pay a tax for their desertion.

caption:
Cham (Amédée-Charles-Henri Comte de Noé) (French, 1818–1879), No. 113, Après Le Siège (After the Siege), plate 39 from Album du siège : recueil de caricatures publiées pendant le siège dans le Charivari
, 1870. Lithograph. Gift of Stephen Spector (ui.2012.1657)
